title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be accessed until the changes are saved. The user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. A dialog titled "Error" appears. The options displayed are: "Yes" to save the changes, "No" to discard the changes, and "Cancel" to do nothing and remain on the Source page.
OB: When editing XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating the need to save the changes. The user should be prompted with clear options to save, discard, or cancel the changes.
EB: Improve the error message to explicitly state that the changes need to be saved, discarded, or canceled. Instead of a dialog titled "Error", consider using a more descriptive title such as "Unsaved Changes" or "Save Changes".
SR: Update the behavior of the XML Report Designer editor so that when switching from the "source" view to the Layout view, users are presented with a clear prompt to save, discard, or cancel their changes.
